[O] Astraea 04/11/2023 12:15 am

Please Read

This channel is for receiving your feedback on the the TLF Faction that will be playable during the playtests. We want to hear from you! the good, bad and ugly. Let us know here! If you have a bug to report, please use either the #tlf-bugs channel Keep this channel to constructive feedback, this channel is NOT intended for discussions. Please keep all discussion in #tlf-discussion. We will remove discussion and issue moderation actions if necessary.

maroon 04/11/2023 9:32 pm
Had the chance to check out TLF. Here's all my feedback to OWI.
  • Addition of MPT-55 and MPT-55K. Historically, Turkey has always fielded two primary rifles, one in 7.62 and one in 5.56. Previously this was the HK G3 and HK 33. Both are replaced by MPT-76 and MPT-55 respectively. While both are used, the MPT-55 was way more common with Turkish commandos deployed in Syria.
  • Replacement of MG3 with PKM. The MG3 has been in the Turkish arsenal for a very long time and was more common in the 1990's and 2000's. Nowadays most commando units are issued PKM's with either irons, A940 or a thermal scope.
  • Replacement of Huey with T-70, Turkish Blackhawk variant. Once again, Huey was mostly used during the 1990's and 2000's. While still in the Turkish inventory, they are no longer used in any deployments, whether in Iraq or Syria. The T-70 comes in either black or the usual Turkish desert vehicle camo.
  • Addition of Leopard 2A4, possibly 2A4T1 variant. Both the Leopard 2A4 and M60T are in active use with the TLF. Could possibly switch the tanks up for different layers.
  • Rework of camo. I think this is already being done (?) but the pattern is slightly off and the colors are a bit too bright.
  • Removal of Gendarme kit. The Turkish Gendarmerie is an entirely different branch of the Turkish Armed Forces and this kit doesn't make much sense. Perhaps it can be renamed to Pointman if an infantry kit with the SAR-109T is required, although this would also be unlikely to be seen in reality.
  • Addition of BMC Kirpi MRAP. This is a must have for TLF. The Cobra II that is currently in game is mostly used by the Gendarmerie and Police Special Operations units. The Kirpi has two variants, Kirpi and Kirpi II, both of them are suitable.
  • Along with the Kirpi, the BMC Vuran MRAP is also very common with Turkish infantry commandos.
  • Addition of SAR 9 METE as primary issue pistol.
  • Rework of the vehicle desert camos. A brighter orange-ish color would be more accurate.

Cubec 10/11/2023 2:31 am
I'd like to point out that the UH-1H is wrong for the Faction as Ground Aviation Command nowadays rarely use Huey for transport as they're being phased out of service(since 2006), instead they use Blackhawks (entered the Inventory in 1990's) a lot more. HK416 19/11/2023 1:17 pm
Hello everyone. as a Turk i tried the Turkish soldier on the test server and saw that there were some shortcomings. First of all, there is an obvious mistake in the camouflage. Our army does not use camouflage in this color. I'm adding a few photos as an example, you can take a look. Many people have already touched on this situation. Secondly, no unit in the Turkish army actively uses the UH-1. Blackhawks, which you know as UH-60, are used in each unit. It is referred to as T70 in the Turkish army. If we talk about vehicles, I saw that the M60T was added and frankly I do not see a big problem here, but our army also actively uses the Leopard and I think it will be better in terms of balance if leopards are added. Cobra 2 is a vehicle mostly used by special operations units. I think it would be more suitable for land forces if Kirpi 2 is added instead, but if it stays like this, there will be no problem, it looks nice as it is. If we talk about weapons, weapons such as MPT-76, KNT-76, SAR-109T are very good, but I cannot say the same for MG3 because our army does not actively use MG3. It would be much better if a PKM bixi and with a scope were added to it. These are my suggestions and complaints for now. I believe many problems will be solved. I wish you all a good day. At ease. (edited)

Der Shredder started a thread. 26/11/2023 2:53 pm
whhhhaaattheeefckiseconommmy 26/11/2023 5:19 pm
I appeal to my Turkish friends, please try to be more realistic. If we come up with unrealistic things, the return channel can be closed. If we want to change the color of the helmet and camouflage, just say so and make a joint decision. Instead of blocking the development process by presenting different and complex ideas that will get little support, let's support the ideas that are valued and get more votes. I don't think it will be possible to change certain things after the development team has done what they have to do, because adding something new would tire the development team and add pressure on them, for example asking for a Leopard 2A4 instead of the M60 tank. So we just need to support a specific idea thank you. Cubec 29/11/2023 4:00 pm
Now, I'd like to point out everything wrong with the Turkish Land Forces Faction in-game, in my personal opinion, this has been by far the worst representation of a nations faction in squad. I'd first like to start off with the Helicopter; UH-1H has not been used in frontline service since 2004. The Huey had been deemed and is an unreliable platform for such a task, there has been more pilots killed in accidents involving the Huey's mechanical problems than there has been in Anti-terrorism operations. (There are a total of 95 accident accident records belonging to UH-1 and AB-205 type helicopters.) which is the main reason why they are not utilized frequently by the Land Forces. Huey today is only used in Logistical operations between barracks and depots. other use the Huey sees is in the Air Force as Training Platform for Helicopter Pilots which is the only Active use they see today. To fix this Inaccuracy the UH-60 has to be added; The UH-60, or Blackhawk, has been in primary use by the Land Forces since it entered service way back in 1989. The Blackhawk has considerably done a lot more Troop Transport and involved in Operations than the Huey has done in last 10 years. Due to its Reliability and great Cargo Capacity it has been the overall Favorite of the Land Forces. The Blackhawk's success has been so great that even the General Directorate of Security(Police and Gendermerie) use them aswell. The UH-1H in game would be far more suited for MEA, as they are based off of the Iranian Forces, which their Ground Aviation use the Huey a lot more than anyone else. 1st Picture: an UH-1H of the Karamürsel Air Force Training Base returning to base -Photo taken by me. 2nd Picture: a Blackhawk during exercises -Photo by Özkan Bilgin. (edited)
79
1
Cubec 29/11/2023 4:21 pm
APC's: The Cobra 2 and PARS III Vehicles represented in game are Vehicles that are not utilized by the Land Forces the PARS Vehicle family is planned to enter service in late 2020's, there has been a tender for an order of around ~2000 Vehicles. as of now PARS III's are only used by the Special Forces Command in numbers around ~10 to 20 Vehicles. As for the Cobra 2; it has been more frequently used by the Gendermerie against anti-terror operations utilizing its MRAP Capabilities and Rugged Armor against urban threats. The Cobra 2 has been rarely used by the Land Forces for Border Patrols and Internal Operations. (The Cobra 2 in game is also inaccurate, with significantly smaller wheels, and inaccurate scale.) To fix this Inaccuracy the Kirpi and Vuran Platforms has to be added; The Kirpi has been in use since early 2010's, serving as the Main MRAP Platform for the Land Forces. Land Forces have used the Kirpi 1 intensively on its operations. After Kirpis started to be operated, Turkish Land Forces’ casualties started to reduce significantly. After this initial success of the Kirpi, its total sales number increased to more than 1,500. After the Kirpi 1’s 7 years of service, with the gained experience and feedback received from users, the Kirpi 2 was introduced in 2018, with several improvements upon the Kirpi 1. In 2018, BMC was awarded another contract by the SSB for 529 units of Kirpi 2 MRAP vehicles. Kirpi 1 is both used by Gendermerie and Police forces aside from the Land Forces. The Vuran has been designed as a Modular Multi Role MRAP, filling the gap for a lighter Vehicle, Vuran has been used intesively in Operations in Syria along with Kirpi's. Vuran platform has been serving as the Secondary MRAP supporting the larger Kirpi MRAP's in Urban Operations. 1st Picture: Vuran MRAP vehicles during NATO Exercise Steadfast Defender 2021. 2nd Picture: Kirpi 1 with Cage Armor in Syria 3rd Picture Kirpi 2 during a Border Patrol in Syria (edited)

nitrat 02/12/2023 3:56 pm
So, I've been reading the feedback here for a while and have also talked with many people from Turkey, Europe, and Asia, listened to their ideas about the TLF update. I'm going to provide a quick summary of what the community thinks about TLF from what I've gathered.

Very Important

LOW EFFORT HIGH IMPACT

These are the stuff that I strongly advise you to change before the launch of the update.

  • Gloves: Just copy and paste from another faction if you don't have time or manpower to model new ones.
  • Helicopters: Yes, UH-1Hs were a part of TLF, but they have not been used for a long while now (due to their issues). TLF mostly uses Blackhawks for transport missions. Since we already have the Blackhawk in the game, it shouldn't be a huge workload to change the flag on the model. However, you can still keep UH-1Hs on some layers (maybe against insurgents; I don't know), similar to Canada having two different helicopters.
  • Music: I liked the menu music even though it has nothing to do with TAF, and I believe composing a new one will be too much work, so I won't suggest you change the main menu music since it sounds unrealistic at this point. But please, please, please, please change TLF's themes. Better sounds have been suggested here multiple times. These are just 4-5 second short audio clips and shouldn't be too hard to switch with new ones.
57
1
3:56 pm

Important

HIGH-MEDIUM EFFORT HIGH IMPACT

I also advised you to change these things before the update, but they can also wait until after the release to see how things are and be fixed with a rework, similar to what the British army underwent.

  • HAT issue. To be honest, I don't know how I would fix this issue. Only two realistic ways come to mind. The first one is just adding an RPG-7 with a tandem warhead. The second is the Carl-Gustav. As far as I know, these are not widely used, but they still exist. Since Turkey has received a light tank (M60T) instead of its main battle tank (Leopard 2T1/2A4TR), they lack anti-tank power. This should be addressed somehow.
  • Instead of an HAT kit, a Leopard 2A4TR next to the light tanks could also balance things. Having both an HAT and a Leopard would create better balance, but I have a feeling none of these feedbacks will change your mind, so I'm trying not to push too much.
  • I was expecting to see one of those BMC's MRAPs instead of some armoured personnel carrier. Since these Kirpis have been used and proven themselves, even in Ukraine, it was disappointing for me to not see them with the TLF faction.
  • Since the infantry update, heavy rifles (G3A3, G3A4, FAL) have become difficult to use. Since the MPT-76 uses the 7.62×51mm NATO round, it's obviously a heavy rifle. However, this rifle also has a 5.56×45mm NATO version called the MPT-55, which is widely used by the land forces. Again, for balancing purposes and to keep this faction playable and enjoyable, you should consider adding this version to some of the kits.

Cyntrax 05/12/2023 8:36 pm
I don't think the current music for the Turkish faction is the worst it can be. But I also disagree with what I see here in this channel between the two sides which are usually made up of Turkish people. I disagree that the music for the Turkish faction should be Ottoman inspired. This is a nation that rose from the ashes of that empire, it shouldn't have the same representation. You don't see the current German government using HRE music directly, but you do see some Germans respecting it, just like with some Turks in Turkey about the Ottoman Empire. But we're not here for Neo propaganda. On the other hand, using direct modern Western Orchestras to represent a faction is stale, boring, and inaccurate to the core culture. The Turkish National Anthem or the TLF Anthem should not be used. You don't see the U.S. factions being represented with OH SAY CAN YOU SEE, they are represented with classic American ROCK. The Chinese faction isn't represented by their orchestral (heavily western) National Anthem, they are represented by a very... Chinese music in the main menu and in-match phases. So, I think the Turkish faction should be represented by the musical culture of their country. If the US get American rock, the PLA get Chinese vocals, the TLF should get something... Turkish in their music. So I propose something heavily Turkish Folk Music inspired. Definitely should include the Turkish Saz or Baglama as some call it. If someone tells you that instrument doesn't represent Turkey, they are just wrong. I will post the image for the instrument and also an example soundtrack made for Battlefield 1 that uses this instrument and is an inherently Turkish soundtrack. (edited)

But the British faction got a Prototype Warrior that is not in service and will never be in service as a vehicle to balance against the Bradley and BMP-2 of the US and Russian factions. They got a semi-fictional vehicle for the sake of balance and variety and adding something new to the game. This fact alone leaves the door open to adding one of these "not currently in service tanks" to be added to the game. If we are content with the CTAS Warrior, we shouldn't be too hostile to the idea of adding TLF tank that isn't fully in service yet, but will be in the future. It's more realistic than the British scenario at least, and not inaccurate. I am writing this cause I see a lot of opponents against adding a vehicle that's not in service but will be in the future, when Squad already features a vehicle that will never be in service. I think the Altay tank would be the "coolest" and unique. A close relative to the Korean Panther. Leopard 2A4T1 would be the best "realistic" option I think. The shape of the camo is just completely off, not to mention, not even the right colors, it's not accurate to the M2008 nor the M2015 camo. The uniforms are also too tight, looks like spandex. The boots are the wrong color, Turkish troops mostly wear tan boots. The choice of vehicles is very odd. The Otokar Cobra II is not used by the TLF. The PARS III is not used by the TLF. The UH-1 Huey is not used by the TLF. The M60 Sabra is used, but it's weak, with the faction having no HAT kit, this limits the faction's anti-tank capability even more. The BMC Efe truck is used, but massively outnumbered by the Mercedes Unimog. The TLF ingame lack some of their signature vehicles like the BMC Kirpi, which is the MRAP they use the most by far. Aswell as the Leopard 2A4, which they have used for decades. Having a Leopard 2A4 in tandem with the M60 would definitely improve TLF's anti-tank capabilities. There is also the lack of a UH-60 Blackhawk, which have served the Turkish Land Forces for decades, there are pictures of UH-60s being used in anti-terror operations all the way back in the 1990s, so the addition of a Huey instead is very weird. The lack of a HAT kit is a problem, infantry will practically be defenseless against armored vehicles, and will require emplacements or friendly vehicles to protect them from enemy vehicles. This issue can be prevented with the addition of an Eryx HAT kit, which despite being an ATGM, is often shoulder-fired, it weighs roughly the same as the NLAW. The MG3 has not been used in combat basically since the 90s, and the Turkish Land Forces mostly uses the PKM, more than the MG3 or the PMT-76. Seeing how there's already an MG3 ingame, It would be better to replace that with the PKM, giving TLF a more east-west mixed vibe. The TLF has never mounted MG3s on vehicles, especially not in RWS form. Jandarma kit (???)

Prigozhin 26/12/2023 6:45 pm
Most games I play as TLF, I lose. It is so weak against armour. The armoured vehicles are overall weak. Besides no vehicle has ATGM. Also, there is no HAT kit. I understand that Turkish Land Forces is supposed to be a strong anti-infantry faction rather than a strong anti-armour faction for some reason. But TLF's anti-infantry capabilites aren't as good in practice as they are in theory. TLF has MG3 and MKE MGL as their ''strong anti-infantry advantages'' in theory, but these assets don't make much of a difference in combat. MG3 is good for suppression but it doesn't have a gunsight. And players don't rely that much on machine gun suppression as much as the OWI thinks. TLF's Automatic rifleman role isn't even used by players almost half the time. Any other light machine gun would do just fine. MG3 isn't THAT much of an advandage. And when it comes to MKE MGL:... Well, spamming grenades against enemy infantry is nice and all but this is the only advantage that TLF has. And that advantage is screwed up by the standard issue rifle anyway: The MPT-76. It has way too much recoil even after only one shot. It is the worst assault rifle in the game because it's recoil is very diffucult to control. That recoil isn't even a side effect of something good. The gun takes two bullets to kill an enemy infantry most of the time just like any other gun. It has no advantage. I found myself losing so many gunfights that I could have won with a different assault rifle. Heck, even G3 is better. Which was replaced by MPT. MPT-55 must be added to the TLF. OR:... You could add it as an option for all maps BUT the desert maps. It would make sense too. In real life; in a place like Talil, the gunfights would be usually fought on longer ranges. TLF would use MPT-76, which is long range weapon made for fighting terrorists on deserts and mountains. Only in desert maps, MPT-55 would not be an option. TLF would use MPT-55 in a conventional war on European continent more than MPT-76 in real life. (edited)

Bucket started a thread. 21/01/2024 10:11 pm
Bucket 22/01/2024 7:02 pm
The Turkish Land Forces faction needs a dramatic rework, it's painfully inaccurate.
  • The MPT-76 and MPT-55 were rolled out around the same time, it would only make sense for them to have some MPT-55 kits
  • The BMC Kirpi is not in the game despite being the most common Turkish MRAP by far.
  • The PARS III is in the game despite not being adopted.
  • The MG3 is used ingame despite not being used in operations since the late 90s, being mostly replaced by the PKM
  • The Huey is used ingame depsite being retired in the 2000s, it should be replaced by the Blackhawk
  • The MG3 is used in remote weapon systems ingame, despite the fact that the two main RWS used by the Turkish army are the FN MAG (SAR-762) and M2, the MG3 has never been used in a RWS platform
  • The playermodels are entirely wrong. The uniforms look like a very poor attempt at recreating the M2008 pattern. The helmets are also oddly vibrant. Not to mention the weird round flag patches.
  • The Leopard 2A4 should be added to provide a significant anti-tank capability against conventional factions. The M60 is too weak.
  • Gendarmerie is just a super weird role to have ingame. It's not a role in the Turkish Land Forces. It's not even in the Armed Forces. It's more like National Guard.
  • Having the BMC Efe as the logi isn't inaccurate, but the Mercedes Unimog would be more appropriate. There's thousands of Unimogs and only a few hundred BMC Efe.
